Data: 9.30am Some team news before the toss. Australia have rung the changes and named two debutants in the same match, with Joe Mennie and Chris Tremain becoming ODI players No.215 and No.216. And talking of the toss, Steve Smith has won the toss and will bowl first.
Tremain to de Kock, no run decent pace, outside off, and squirted to point off a fat outside edge. Decent start
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run decent area once again as de Kock rocks back into the crease to flick his first single through the leg side

Tremain to Rossouw, FOUR runs lovely timing! Really not a lot wrong with that delivery, full, tight, a hint of swing back into the left-hander. But Rossouw's timing picks up where it left off at Centurion. Whistles through midwicket
Tremain to Rossouw, 2 runs the outfield is lightning quick as this one is punched from under the eyeline into the covers
Tremain to Rossouw, no run forward and defended to mid-off
Tremain to Rossouw, no run up onto the toes, defended back down the pitch. Not a bad maiden over. But it's not a maiden over. If you see what I did there
Mennie to de Kock, no run good delivery, shaping from leg to off on a good line and length. Defended
Mennie to de Kock, 1 run on the pads, flicked hard to the sweeper behind square
Mennie to Rossouw, FOUR runs spanked! That was an over-pitched outswinging half-volley, and Rossouw drills it with a big stride, an elegant knee-bend and a whoomph of bat
Mennie to Rossouw, FOUR runs good riposte! A genuine lifter from a full, tight length. Takes a fat edge and eludes Smith, diving to his left at a solitary slip
Mennie to Rossouw, no run lifting off a good length again, and defended with one hand
Mennie to Rossouw, 1 run calmly defended into the off-side, where a misfield gifts an extra single. Whoops. The outfield didn't help there, to be fair
Tremain to Rossouw, FOUR runs short and wide, I'm afraid that's rubbish in any format. Rossouw frees his hands and flings an uppercut four over backward point

Tremain to Rossouw, 2 runs better line and length, but that's some lovely timing through the covers, and the outfield is so quick it's as if the ball has been given an armed escort to the boundary as the fielder sprints to stay level with it
Tremain to Rossouw, 2 runs hauled into the leg side, the pressure's on for the debutants
Tremain to Rossouw, no run round the wicket, and that's a fine delivery. Kicks off the turf and beats the outside edge
Tremain to Rossouw, no run a crunching cut into the off side but can't pierce the infield this time
Tremain to Rossouw, no run on the back foot, drilled hard into the covers
Mennie to de Kock, no run onto the front foot, pushed to the off side
Mennie to de Kock, 2 runs poor delivery once again, curling into the pads which is never a good idea against de Kock. Fierce timing through the leg side but a fine diving stop to save the four
Mennie to de Kock, no run defended into the off side
Mennie to de Kock, no run forward to defend back down the track
Mennie to de Kock, FOUR runs lovely strike, full face, pummelled down the ground
Mennie to de Kock, 2 runs on the pads again, whipped hard through midwicket and an instant call of two. South Africa are cooking
Tremain to Rossouw, no run tight line, lifting off the deck, defended to the off side
Tremain to Rossouw, FOUR runs power, placement and not even the pretence of a jog down the track, That was four from the moment it was flogged dismissively on the up through the covers
Tremain to Rossouw, no run tighter to off stump and a bit of nibble off the pitch. Well bowled
Tremain to Rossouw, no run well bowled again, round the wicket and on that perfect length that is never quite there to drive or defend. Nips through the gate but past the stumps

Tremain to Rossouw, FOUR runs tremendous ball-striking, just a fraction too full and met with a lashing blade, hitting straight through the line, working against the inswing to pound it through the covers
Tremain to Rossouw, no run another decent comeback but beats the edge to no avail
Mennie to de Kock, 1 run punched on the up through point
Mennie to Rossouw, no run left well, almost a Test-match moment there. Line and length from the bowler, and respect from the batsman
Mennie to Rossouw, no run full and probing, right in the blockhole
Mennie to Rossouw, no run this is turning into a good over, another tight and attacking delivery, good length and curling towards the off stump
Mennie to Rossouw, no run forward and defended into the off side
Mennie to Rossouw, no run defended into the off side
Tremain to de Kock, no run fully forward and well stopped in the followthrough
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run round the wicket, punched on the up to cover
Tremain to Rossouw, no run speared in towards the toes, defended from deep in the crease
Tremain to Rossouw, no run high elbow action as Rossouw attempts to drive a full-length ball straight back past the bowler. Mid-on tidies up
Tremain to Rossouw, no run settling well into this over now, wider on the crease from round the wicket and defended to the off side
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run fuller and drilled hard back down the track, where the non-striker's stumps act as a 12th fielder
Mennie to Rossouw, 1 run angled defence into the off side
Mennie to de Kock, 1 run width, and flashed through third man
Mennie to Rossouw, FOUR runs crunched on the up through the covers once again. That has been a bread-and-butter stroke for Rossouw in the past 48 hours
Mennie to Rossouw, no run tighter line, solid defence
Mennie to Rossouw, 1 run patted out to cover
Mennie to de Kock, no run good bowling once again, no width to work with, as the bowler fields in his followthrough
Hastings to Rossouw, no run undercut out to point, the shot was on but the execution was lacking for a change
Hastings to Rossouw, FOUR runs that's impeccable. Just a fraction short, and slammed on the up through the covers once again. The timing is sensational
Hastings to Rossouw, FOUR runs too much width, and Rossouw flings the sink at it, outside off. Takes a fat flying edge and fizzes over the cordon through third man
Hastings to Rossouw, no run that's better, tighter line and length, and defended
Hastings to Rossouw, no run opens the face, and attempts a glide through third man. But point pounces
Hastings to Rossouw, no run round the wicket, angling in, defended to the leg side
Mennie to de Kock, no run clipped off the straight and narrow, out to the leg side

Mennie to de Kock, FOUR runs stunning placement through the covers once again. Just dobbed on a spankable length outside off, no lateral movement on offer, save that of a thumping piece of willow swinging through the line
Mennie to de Kock, no run nudged into the leg side
Mennie to de Kock, 2 runs too much width, but it works in the circumstances, as de Kock doesn't quite read the slower ball. Deep point gathers
Mennie to de Kock, 1 run full and dabbed into the leg side
Mennie to Rossouw, no run outside off, lifting through to the keeper with some extra zip. That's a good finish
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run dabbed into the off side and more sharp running
Hastings to Rossouw, 1 run outside off, driven on the up through the covers
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run another dabbed single behind square on the off side
Hastings to Rossouw, 1 run a bit of an inside edge on this one as Hastings probes a tight line
Hastings to de Kock, no run too much width but Warner at point is on hand to intercept a lashing cut. Lucky let-off
Hastings to de Kock, OUT a big heave down the ground, it looks elegant enough, but he's not middled it at all! Right off the toe, a gentle back-pedal at mid-on, and Australia have the breakthrough!
Marsh to Rossouw, no run tight defence on off stump
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 run extra bounce, defended with the bottom hand coming loose from the handle

Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run driven into the covers, du Plessis scampers the single into the covers, and wears the shy from Aaron Finch on his wrist as he makes his ground! He looks seriously discomforted by that ... he put his hand up to defend himself as the throw came in, and was struck flush on the thumb. Ouch
Marsh to Rossouw, no run patted into the covers as Marsh finds some extra bounce
Marsh to Rossouw, no run round the wicket, probing line and length, Rossouw tightens up in defence
Marsh to Rossouw, no run that's a good finish to the over. Tight angled delivery into the left-hander, forcing a respectful defensive prod from a very well-set batsman
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run lifting into the splice and deflected to the leg side
Hastings to Rossouw, no run defended into the off side, more constrictive work from round the wicket
Hastings to Rossouw, 1 run thrashed out to deep point, and that is Rossouw's fifty, his second in as many matches!
Hastings to du Plessis, no run blocked back down the wicket
Hastings to du Plessis, no run back of a length, defended into the off side, as Australia begin to settle into a strong spell of seam bowling
Hastings to du Plessis, no run outside off, a hint of movement off the deck to disrupt a firm drive into the covers
Marsh to Rossouw, no run solidly forward, defended back down the track
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 run nudged into the leg side from an instant call, Marsh reacts quickly in his followthrough but du Plessis was on his toes and makes it home easily enough
Marsh to du Plessis, no run attempted yorker, decently executed. Another valuable dot-ball as du Plessis digs it out
Marsh to du Plessis, no run defended into the off side, more tight bowling
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs there we go, the dam finally breaks as this one offers up just a hint too much width, and du Plessis pushes with an open face through third man
Marsh to du Plessis, no run angled into the off side, no way through there
Hastings to Rossouw, no run round the wicket, defended out to cover
Hastings to Rossouw, 2 runs down the track, a bit of ambition in that footwork, as the ball is filleted down to third man. Think he's bored of being hemmed in
Hastings to Rossouw, 1 run chopped into the off side, not a lot of finesse, but finds enough of a gap to steal the single
Hastings to du Plessis, no run outside off, du Plessis hops across his stumps to drive into the covers
Hastings to du Plessis, FOUR runs fetch that! Du Plessis uses his feet this time, trusting the surface and exploiting the field. Into position early and a flog through the line, over extra cover
Hastings to du Plessis, no run flashed hard out to point
Marsh to Rossouw, no run tight line, defended into the off side
Marsh to Rossouw, 2 runs walks down the track and across the stumps to create a low full toss, wafted round the corner
Marsh to Rossouw, no run blocked out to the covers
Marsh to Rossouw, no run fenced into the leg side
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 run cut hard into the off side, and another scampered single
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs too full, but well played from du Plessis, bissecting the two men behind square with a whistling clip! Top shot
Zampa to Rossouw, no run tosses one up from over the wicket, Rossouw leans out and defends, like a dog sniffing a nettle
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run drags this one down a bit, the batsman rocks back and swats a pull through square leg
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run pushed through outside the line of off, du Plessis sits in the crease and steers through point
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run floated up on the stumps, comes forward, drives one more to long-on
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run not much sign of turn, skids on outside off, poked through cover point
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run drops short again, Rossouw wheels through another pulled single to deep square leg
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 run back of a length outside off, 120kph and dabbed through backward point for one
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run banged in short and du Plessis cracks a pull into the deep, straight to the boundary rider
Marsh to Rossouw, no run comes across and prods into the covers
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 wide dug in short, that's risen too much for the umpires' liking
Marsh to Rossouw, no run full outside off, maybe a cross-seamer? Skips through a bit low as Rossouw flays unsuccessfully

Marsh to Rossouw, no run one the walk, tucks the ball down into the on side, Rossouw is looking for one but the ball goes straight to Marsh... who misfields it, with the stumps unguarded! Could have been a real chance, that. Not sure where Rossouw was going
Marsh to Rossouw, no run pitched up, 126kph and punched into the covers
Zampa to du Plessis, no run flighted, comes forward on middle and works to mid-on, well stopped on the dive
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up and this time du Plessis gets it down to long-on for one
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run pushed through quicker, Rossouw pushes back past the bowler again
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up and worked off the pads through square leg
Zampa to Rossouw, no run flat, skidding on as Rossouw drops back, mistimes a pull into the ground and Zampa fields
Zampa to Rossouw, 2 runs sliding across the lefty, no turn and he slices into a gap at deep backward point for two
Mennie to du Plessis, 1 run shortish and flicked behind square on the leg side
Mennie to Rossouw, 1 run pitched up outside off, Rossouw flannels it through the covers to the sweeper
Mennie to du Plessis, no run fullish, presses forward on off, tapped away
Mennie to du Plessis, FOUR runs smashed, high over extra cover, plopping just short of the rope... No mercy for Mennie, as du Plessis dances out and tangos an aerial drive with major hangtime
Mennie to du Plessis, 1 run slower ball, comes across and dinks into a gap
Mennie to Rossouw, no run waits in the crease and angles the ball towards backward point - not too much damage for the Menster in the end
Zampa to du Plessis, no run floated up outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
Zampa to du Plessis, no run gives it some air, du Plessis gets into line and taps away in front of square
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs touch too full from Zampa and du Plessis spanks him over extra cover, goes inside out again, really well timed because he wasn't quite to the pitch, powerful wristwork
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs slightly short this time, again not a bad ball but du Plessis flashes a cut behind deep point, beats the man to the rope, four more!
Zampa to du Plessis, no run tossed up on middle and leg, worked back down the track
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run gets on to the front foot and pushes one into the covers to finish an expensive over
Mennie to du Plessis, 1 run pitched up and driven off the toes fine of mid-on
Mennie to Rossouw, 1 run short ball, Rossouw is seeing it well, rocks into position and bludgeons a flat pull straight to the man at deep square leg for just a single
Mennie to du Plessis, no run back over the wicket, dug in short, turned to leg but they think better of running
Mennie to du Plessis, 1 run slightly back of a length, stays on the back foot and punches to the cover sweeper

Mennie to Rossouw, FOUR runs woof, that's an umpire killer! Pitched up, 134kph and it disappears back a few clicks quicker, I'd wager, hammered through the line and Nigel Llong throws himself overboard as Mennie glances back to see the ball thump into the boards
Mennie to Rossouw, 2 runs on the body, nudged through the leg side and into a gap for two
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run floated up, slow and loopy, driven through the off side
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run pushed across the left-hander, he comes foward and steers through the covers for one more
Zampa to du Plessis, no run slows it down again, tapped away towards cover
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs pick that out, another off-side thump from Faf, gets a stride in and clubs over cover for four more
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run shuffles out and dinks a drive back down the ground to long-on
Zampa to Rossouw, no run tossed up on the stumps, works across the line to midwicket
Tremain to du Plessis, no run length ball, 138kph around off, turned to the leg side and they abort on the single
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run slightly wider line, Faf drops back and glides a single to third man
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run uses the feet again, not quite to the pitch and the bat turns in the hands as Rossouw drives, bobbles along the carpet to mid-off on the edge of the ring
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run full and straight, 139kph and flicked neatly off the toes through square leg
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run round the wicket, pitched up and clipped down the ground to long-on

Tremain to du Plessis, FOUR runs more tap for the new boys, a stiff-armed jab down the ground, du Plessis strolling out and crunching a straight drive through the line, Stevie Smith gives valiant chase and goes barreling into the rope but can't prevent a boundary

Hastings to Rossouw, OUT shortish and Rossouw pulls, sends it swirling into the Joburg atmosphere - taken at deep square leg! Not the most calculated of risks, looked like a long boundary out that direction and it was well short of carrying, Hastings again the bowler to strike. Looks like it was a cross-seamer that did for Rossouw... and a bit of a lucky take
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run the batsmen crossed, Faf pushes into a gap at cover for one
Hastings to Duminy, no run round the wicket, good length on off and defended coming forwards
Hastings to Duminy, no run comes across on off and blocks
Hastings to Duminy, 1 wide bouncer, welcome to the jungle, 133kph but trampolining through... too high
Hastings to Duminy, no run another short ball, outside off and JP gets into line this time
Hastings to Duminy, no run good length outside the line of off, Duminy settles for seeing off the over and prods into the covers
Tremain to du Plessis, 2 runs full and straight, du Plessis whips firmly to leg, won't quite beat the man in the deep - but two more brings up a half-century for the SA captain, who's going nicely
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run angled in with the arm, nudged off the legs for one more
Tremain to Duminy, 1 run over the wicket to the left-hander, pitched up and driven through the covers to get going
Tremain to du Plessis, no run zoinks, that did something! Only 128kph from Tremain but the seam was rotating and it leapt off a length, past the shoulder of the bat as du Plessis' eyes widened
Tremain to du Plessis, FOUR runs goes for the yorker, not quite where he wanted it and du Plessis drills it back down the ground, beats two fielders to the long-on rope
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run fullish and in the channel this time, reaches for the swipe and the ball flies aerially through backward point
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run stops in the pitch a fraction, through the drive early but it loops wide of Hastings in his follow through and runs to long-off
Hastings to Duminy, no run comes across on off and blocks a length ball
Hastings to Duminy, no run dug in, 130 kays, flying through above the ducking Duminy (not a euphemism)
Hastings to Duminy, no run touch back of a length outside off, dropped into the covers and fielded quickly
Hastings to Duminy, 1 run length, angled in from round the wicket, Duminy closes the face and flicks one through backward square leg
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run goes back and across outside off, opens the face and glides one more to third man
Head to du Plessis, 2 runs dobbed on the pads, du Plessis flicks it through square, there's a man coming in off the boundary but they make it back for a second easily enough
Head to du Plessis, FOUR runs full and floaty wide of the stumps, a gimme for the set batsman and he booms the half-volley through cover point for four
Head to du Plessis, no run darted in flatter on the stumps, gets a leading edge looking to turn to leg
Head to du Plessis, no run goes round the wicket, tossed up outside off, maybe some turn there as du Plessis plays and misses
Head to du Plessis, 1 run gets this one away off his pads for a single
Head to Duminy, 1 run floated up in the channel outside off, Duminy steps out and drives through point
Hastings to Duminy, FOUR runs short ball, goes for the hook this time... top-edged to fine leg for four! Duminy not in control but he'll take the runs
Hastings to Duminy, no run comes across and pushes into the covers
Hastings to Duminy, no run good length in the channel and again Duminy pushes it cautiously away
Hastings to Duminy, 1 run pitched up a little further, uses the feet and steers a drive out to deep point
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run pitched up outside off, check-drive from du Plessis, bounces through mid-off
Hastings to Duminy, 2 runs short at the body, paddled around the corner on the back foot, that'll be a couple to fine leg
Head to du Plessis, 1 run lobbed up on middle and off, clumped through mid-off on the move
Head to Duminy, 1 run tossed up and chipped over the off side, won't quite carry all the way to deep extra cover running in
Head to du Plessis, no run quick and flat and pushed away into the covers
Head to du Plessis, 5 wide big turn... but unfortunately for Australia it has turned well down the leg side and run for extras. Maybe hit a crack?
Head to du Plessis, 1 run floated up on the stumps and worked through midwicket for a single

Head to Duminy, FOUR runs flighted, definitely some turn for Head this time, takes the outside edge as Duminy pushes at it, but he got enough on the ball to send it wide of Wade's gloves and running fine for four more
Head to Duminy, 1 run tossed up and clipped to leg for another single
Zampa to Duminy, no run floated up on the stumps, plays with the turn towards midwicket, Smith cleans up
Zampa to Duminy, no run pushed across, stays in the crease and prods to extra cover
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run outside off and Duminy opens the face to slide a single through backward point
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run bit slower, outside the line of off, dabbed into the covers
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run on the stumps, waits for it and flicks down the ground to long-on
Zampa to du Plessis, no run pushed through a bit quicker on off stump and du Plessis defends this time
Marsh to Duminy, no run round the wicket, shortish outside off, lets it go
Marsh to Duminy, FOUR runs full and now Duminy unleashes, skipping forwards and lofting over mid-off, clears the fielder and picks up four - that's the 50 stand between these two, a tidy partnership
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run draws his length back a touch, comes across and dabs behind square
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run good length in the channel, du Plessis opens the face to third man
Marsh to Duminy, no run pitched up, 128kph in the slot, doesn't quite catch the drive and sends it to backward point
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run full outside off and this time Duminy gets a push in front of square to the sweeper
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run tossed up and poked back past the bowler to long-on
Zampa to du Plessis, no run flighted, comes forward and pushes to mid-off
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run full outside off, steers this one through the covers for one
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run very full, on the toes and thumped back low past the bowler's outstretched hand, just a single to long-on
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs gives it some air... and du Plessis gives it some tap, opening up the body and thrashing a drive through the covers, beats the fielder on the fence!
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run pushed through, nurdled to leg and they scamper one as the fielder homes in
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run outside off, nurdled backward of point
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run round the wicket, banged in short, and hoicked into the leg side with a downward thump of the bat
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run very full, targetting the stumps and drilled firmly up to long-off, very straight ball-striking, nearly flicks the non-strikers' stumps
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run on the hip and dabbed round the corner
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run full and straight again, tapped to mid-on for another sharp single
Marsh to Duminy, FOUR runs too short, and the bounce is too true. Battered in front of square with a rifle-crack of willow
Hastings to Behardien, 1 run working the singles, but the big shots remain a touch elusive...
Hastings to Miller, FOUR runs that's the one! Miller finds his range with a fierce drill through the covers
Hastings to Miller, 1 run driven hard to long-off
Hastings to Behardien, no run driven hard again, but still South Africa's grandest intentions are kept under wraps
Hastings to Behardien, 2 runs slower-ball bouncer, very wide, toe-ended out to cover with a waft of the bat
Hastings to Behardien, 1 run spanked in the air, but not enough distance or power. Just the single. Australia are brawling hard in these final overs

Tremain to Behardien, OUT heaved hard and violently out to deep midwicket! Tremain has his maiden ODI wicket, and it's come at a vital moment! Got right under the shot and gave Warner several decades to contemplate the ball as it fell back to earth. But he judged it just fine and South Africa's charge still hasn't quite materialised
Tremain to Miller, 1 run on the toes, flicked firmly to deep midwicket
Tremain to Parnell, 2 runs slower ball bouncer, Parnell leans back to glide a cut down to third man, where the ball bobbles on the rough outfield but safely into the hands of the fielder
Tremain to Parnell, FOUR runs that's the one they've been waiting for! A full wind-up as Tremain drops short, and Parnell climbs across the line with a firm pull in front of square
Tremain to Parnell, 1 run onto the front foot, and punched down to long-off
Tremain to Miller, 1 run wide of off stump, clubbed out to deep extra cover
Zampa to du Plessis, no run solidly onto the front foot, back foot anchored in the event of spin
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs chipped over the top of the bowler, and bounces away down to long-off
Zampa to du Plessis, no run nudged into the off side
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run patted to leg, and they take the single
Zampa to Duminy, FOUR runs outside off, gave himself room with a shimmy to leg, and freed the hands with a sweet flowing drive over the covers. Opened the face and gave it some humpty
Zampa to Duminy, 1 run clobbered into the deep where Warner does well to gather and release in double-quick time
Marsh to Duminy, FOUR runs no cutting that one off! Width outside off, and walloped high and handsome over the cover field. South Africa are putting the hammer down
Marsh to Duminy, no run tighter line, patted into the covers
Marsh to Duminy, no run tight line on off stump from round the wicket. Defended
Marsh to Duminy, no run outside off, dabbed into the covers, good response to that early-over flogging
Marsh to Duminy, 1 run nudged into the leg side
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run works the gap to keep the strike
Hastings to Miller, FOUR runs whoops, a low full-toss outside off, that's asking for trouble. Miller wallops it for a one-bounce four through wide long-on

Hastings to Miller, OUT chopped hard out to point, and a tumbling stop ... in fact, it's a catch! Zampa reacted so calmly that no-one really noticed it was out. The umpires are taking a look, and lo and behold, the ball buried in his breadbasket! Time is called on Miller Time...
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, no run banged in short, and an ambitious roundhouse swipe, no contact but plenty intent
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 run outside off, dabbed out to point
Hastings to Parnell, 1 run outside off, tapped into the gap
Hastings to Phehlukwayo, 1 run on the pads, worked square for another single. Lucky's first run for South Africa!
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, FOUR runs pounded down the ground for a three-bounce four through long-off! Cleared the front leg to batter a length delivery
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run stunning followthrough, reminiscent of Darren Gough's backside-slapping strokeplay at Sydney in 1994-95, but no contact this time
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, SIX runs he has absolutely battered this one! In the slot, and picks the slower ball as well. Timing, power, placement. Into the stands over the bowler's head!
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, no run another murderous wipe through the line, but connects with nothing but air! I have hit upon a new favourite tailend batsman...
Tremain to Phehlukwayo, 1 run short and wide, if he'd left it he'd have had another go at it, for sure. But instead he toe-ended it down to deep point
Tremain to Parnell, no run slower ball, well disguised, through to the keeper

1.45pm So, that's the end of that. Australia will need 362 to square the series, thanks to an imposing allround batting effort, led by the captain, Faf du Plessis, with Rilee Rossouw and JP Duminy in fine form as well. Back shortly for the chase

Ahoy there, shall we do this? Aaron Finch is scratching his mark and preparing to give it some humpty as Australia seek to chase down what would be a record targets for them in ODIs. Dale Steyn won't be giving anything away easily, though...
Steyn to Finch, no run that's a ripper to start with, leaping like an electrocuted trout off a length, Finch looked startled as he dropped the hands and the ball boomed into the keeper's gloves
Steyn to Finch, no run fullish, tight line of off stump, gets bat on it this time and blocks to cover
Steyn to Finch, 1 run draws him forward, reaching for the ball away from his body as it seams a fraction, keeps it down in front of point and an diving stop keeps them to one
Steyn to Warner, no run oof, takes this in the midriff, at 144kph, too! Slightly short and David Warner's first ball has him hopping around the crease
Steyn to Warner, 1 run pitched up and pushed a little wide, steered through backward point from the crease
Steyn to Finch, no run cripes, another jaffa to finish with, fired in and then zipping away off a length, this close to Finch's outside edge
Rabada to Warner, 1 run angled across and dabbed down behind square on the off side
Rabada to Warner, no run beats the outside edge, that's a snorting ball, too. Warner hung bat and swished, so close to nicking off

Rabada to Warner, 1 leg bye Rabada's burning rubber with these wheels, 146kph and hitting the pads, possibly too high and the ball flies to slip... whose throw is then tipped past midwicket by Rabada in his follow through, gifting a single
Rabada to Smith, no run unplayable! That went straight through Smith as he tried to defend on off stump, just did enough off the deck at a sizzling speed
Rabada to Smith, no run angled in and holding its line, 144kph and past the outside edge again. This is going to be quite a test
Steyn to Warner, no run dug in short and Warner tries to tuck to leg, bottom-edges just past his stumps, I think
Steyn to Warner, no run pace and bounce, rolls his fingers over it and sends a 142kph delivery jagging away past the outside edge
Steyn to Warner, 1 run banged in short and this time Warner is in control of the pull down to fine leg
Steyn to Smith, FOUR runs that's a corking shot to get off the mark with, 139kph outside off, maybe a fraction short and Smith fillets it through cover
Steyn to Smith, FOUR runs two in a row! Smith squints and picks up the gauntlet, using the pace again to fire a 142kph delivery between cover and point
Steyn to Smith, 1 run straighter line from Steyn, shuffles across and works one to square leg
Rabada to Smith, 1 run back of a length, good pace again but calmly worked off the body for one
Rabada to Warner, FOUR runs lashed through point, Warner capitalises on a bit of width and dishes out some treatment to Rabada in kind
Rabada to Warner, no run good length on the stumps, Warner pushes it back towards mid-on
Rabada to Warner, no run flying through in the channel outside off, left alone
Rabada to Warner, no run tucking him up at 143kph, Warner hops back and turns down into the leg side
Rabada to Warner, 1 wide dug in short, climbing through above Warner... called on height
Rabada to Warner, no run fires to ball in full, serious heat at 148kph and Warner has to jam his bat down on it
Steyn to Smith, no run touch short outside off and Smith leaps into line and effects a gunslinger's pose as he attempt to flay another square drive but picks out the fielder
Steyn to Smith, no run length ball, tighter to the stumps and blocked into the covers
Steyn to Smith, 2 runs takes the pace off this, sits up outside off and stunned behind backward point moving across
Steyn to Smith, 1 run goes back and works a straighter delivery through the leg side
Steyn to Warner, no run back of a length over middle and leg, Warner chops down on it
Steyn to Warner, no run touch short, 138kph on the body, spits at Warner and he again is concerned only with defusing the threat
Rabada to Smith, 1 run fired in full and flicked through backward square leg
Rabada to Warner, no run shortish and angled across on off, Warner jabs it away
Rabada to Warner, no run back of a length, slightly wider and inviting the cut, only manages a bottom edge through to the keeper on the bounce
Rabada to Warner, 1 wide banged in but down the leg side
Rabada to Warner, no run Rabada puts it on a length, middle and leg stump at 142kph, worked towards mid-on
Rabada to Warner, no run the change-up works this time, an offcutter deceives Warner, who inside-edges on to his body
Rabada to Warner, FOUR runs short ball, looked to have hurried him... but Warner still manages to bludgeon it through midwicket for four, pulled off the splice of the bat but it outruns the fielder

Steyn to Smith, OUT fired down leg, thick inside edge... WHADDACATCH!!! Steyn gets Smith, though he has de Kock to thank, he flew to his left to hold the chance one-handed, before tumbling and rising in delight to be mobbed by his team-mates. Smiffy's gotta go, via to a worldie from Quinny
Steyn to Bailey, 1 wide welcomes the new man with a bumper, Bailey bails out early... too high
Steyn to Bailey, no run slightly back of a length, tapped down into the off side
Steyn to Bailey, no run good shape on this, 132kph and fading away as Bailey plays inside the line
Steyn to Bailey, no run angled in straighter, menacing the stumps as Bailey hangs back, blunts it into the off side
Steyn to Bailey, 1 run nasty, rising ball, 138kph at the ribs, fended away behind square for Bailey's first run
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs dug in short and Warner hits back with a left cross, swung hard up over midwicket and it races away in front of square for four
Rabada to Bailey, no run pitched up outside off, Bailey stands and clunks a cut-cum-drive off the toe of the bat
Rabada to Bailey, no run better line, Bailey's turned around on off stump, takes the edge but fails short
Rabada to Bailey, no run shorter, rising up at 140kph and fended away in front of the stumps
Rabada to Bailey, no run quicker still, 143kph and Bailey can't do anything with it back in the crease
Rabada to Bailey, no run fullish, outside off, reaches for the drive and inside-edges to leg
Rabada to Bailey, FOUR runs ach, he's got that wrong, a slower ball comes out as a full toss and Bailey bludges it gratefully through the covers for a first boundary
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs there's Warner with the bit between his teeth again, steps out and laces a precision drive between extra cover and mid-off, four more, please
Steyn to Warner, no run shortish and turned off the body to leg
Steyn to Warner, 1 run Steyn digs this in and Warner plays a pull, rolling the wrists out to deep square leg
Steyn to Bailey, FOUR runs minor victory for the bowler, finding the outside edge... but Bailey plays it well, soft hands and opening the face to send it fine of third man
Steyn to Bailey, no run Steyn's dander is up after that, hammers the pitch halfway down, 137kph and defended from the crease
Steyn to Bailey, no run beats the bat to finish the over, a fizzing legbreak from slightly back of a length, Bailey whistles in the wind from deep in the crease
Rabada to Warner, 1 wide short and slightly leg side, Warner flicks and misses

Rabada to Warner, FOUR runs stand and deliver, crashed through the covers, though Rossouw nearly pulls off a screamer diving to his right! It was in the air was quite a way, between two fielders and then skittering away to the rope - that's the 50 up
Rabada to Warner, no run on the stumps and pushed into the off side
Rabada to Warner, no run shortish and this beats Warner on the inside, maybe clips the edge before thudding into the pads
Rabada to Warner, no run back of a length, pushed across and Warner comes forward to block

Rabada to Warner, no run pinned in front, that stayed low... but umpire Llong walks away! After some deliberation, SA ask for the review. They desperately want to get rid of Warner, but this won't be the ball, as it pitched well outside leg stump. Looked like it would have been fuller, given the height at which it went through
Rabada to Warner, 1 run length ball outside off, 144kph and punched on the up into the covers
Parnell to Warner, 1 run over the wicket, banged in and Warner whirls around the crump a pull to deep backward square
Parnell to Bailey, no run goes round the wicket, angled in at 135kph and hitting the pad, possible via an inside edge
Parnell to Bailey, no run shortish and defended on the stumps
Parnell to Bailey, no run keeps bringing the ball back in on the angle, Bailey works to leg
Parnell to Bailey, no run shortish, over off stump, Bailey flaps it down in front of square

Parnell to Bailey, OUT bowled him, off stump pegged back! The pressure was building on Bailey and he went for the big shot, aiming down the ground but it wasn't quite there, seamed a fraction and he played around it as Parnell hit the bull's eye. Parnell then starts dabbing in celebration... that or he's short-circuiting
Phehlukwayo to Warner, 1 run short ball, worked off the hips for a single
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run back of a length on off stump, poked into the covers
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, FOUR runs doesn't take long for Marsh to open up, offered a modicum of width and he mows a drive through backward point to get off the mark with a boundary
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, FOUR runs oh, that's even better, too full from Phehlukwayo and Marsh pings a supremely timed drive back past mid-on
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run pitched up, steps into the drive but this time finds mid-on
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run back of a length, 132kph and blocked on off stump
Parnell to Warner, 1 run short and pushed across outside off, Warner swats through cover point
Parnell to Marsh, 1 leg bye goes round the wicket to the right-hander again, worked away off the pads
Parnell to Warner, 1 run outside off, decent line and Warner stays back to run one to third man
Parnell to Marsh, no run dug in at 138kph from round the wicket, tucked to the leg side
Parnell to Marsh, no run back of a length once again, tapped down towards point

Parnell to Marsh, no run Parnell has found his groove, this flies through at 137kph as Marsh shoudlers arms - now they're not swinging (which is probably wise as Australia need some watchfully rapid consolidation. If that makes any sense)
Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs spiders in and puts the ball on a length, not much turn and Warner drops back to glides the ball to the third-man fence
Tahir to Warner, 1 run floated up outside off, Warner comes forward and punches through mid-off
Tahir to Marsh, no run flighted, spinning away on off stump, Marsh defends
Tahir to Marsh, no run there's the wrong'un, coming back in as the batsman chops to midwicket
Tahir to Marsh, no run tossed up outside the line of off, leans into a prod to cover
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run pushed through a bit quicker, Marsh stays back and jabs to the left of extra cover, could have been tight if the pick up was clean
Parnell to Marsh, FOUR runs dug in, slightly leg side and Marsh gets some glove on the pull, sends it wide of de Kock and that'll be four
Parnell to Marsh, FOUR runs oh, you jammy devil! Marsh gets four more, this time via the inside edge as he propped forwards, can't have been far from taking leg stump
Parnell to Marsh, no run good length on off, 136kph and Marsh blocks this one securely
Parnell to Marsh, 1 run pitched up, invites the drive, gets a thick edge through backward square leg
Parnell to Warner, no run over the wicket, prods forward and gets an inside edge
Parnell to Warner, 1 leg bye slightly short, on the hips and worked around the corner for one - maybe off the padding
Tahir to Warner, 1 run floats the ball up outside the line of off, Warner reaches to slap through the covers
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run goes straighter, full and flighted and bunted down the ground
Tahir to Warner, no run angled across the southpaw, who sits back and tickles towards short third man
Tahir to Warner, no run pushed through on the stumps, Warner presses out to block
Tahir to Warner, 2 runs Warner drops back, think this was the Bosie and he plays it very late, gets it past the fielder for a couple
Tahir to Warner, no run tossed up outside off, angles the bat on the back foot but backward point stops this
Parnell to Head, no run zinger! Outside off, exploding off the deck, and drawing a rather startled jab from the new batsman. Pace and bounce, all the attributes
Parnell to Head, no run this one explodes as well, real zip off the deck as Head lines up a cut but finds himself cramped for room and struck right on the top of his handle!
Parnell to Head, no run fiery work again as Parnell whistles another one through to the keeper, a touch of movement away from the left-hander
Parnell to Head, SIX runs that's the way to do it! If there's lift in the deck, get underneath it and lash it high over third man for six!
Parnell to Head, 1 run nurdled off the hip to keep the runs ticking in a very lively over!
Tahir to Head, 1 run onto the front foot and flicked to the leg side
Tahir to Warner, no run forward and blocked into the off side
Tahir to Warner, 1 run drilled down the ground to long-off
Tahir to Head, no run driven into the covers, just finding his range
Tahir to Head, no run flogged through the off side but with mid-off up in the ring, there are no freebies on offer
Tahir to Head, no run worked off the pad to backward square. Tidy work
Parnell to Warner, 1 run tapped into the off side
Parnell to Head, 2 runs firmly drilled off the back foot, but that's some sure-footed fielding from Imran Tahir at third man, cutting off a whistling stroke and tumbling to keep it in play
Parnell to Head, no run tight defence on the back foot
Parnell to Head, 1 run lashed down to backward point, and once again a forceful stroke is under-rewarded. Still, the hundred is up
Parnell to Warner, no run wicket to wicket, tapped to point
Parnell to Warner, no run outside off and that's another hooter-seeking delivery, just bursting off the turf past a startled edge. Lively!
Phehlukwayo to Head, 1 run on the pads, tucked square for another single
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run outside off, crashing back-cut but straight to the man at backward point
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run opens the face in a attempted glide, but can't find the angle
Phehlukwayo to Warner, no run full length, pushing Warner right back onto his stumps. Tidy work

Phehlukwayo to Warner, FOUR runs a bit of width and this time Warner finds the gap in the covers, and the boundary too, as the man in the deep makes an utter horlicks of the attempted gather, lets it through his feet and onto the rope!

Phehlukwayo to Warner, SIX runs panned high and hard into the stands! Warner isn't giving up the chase just yet! Shorter this time, and climbed alarmingly off the seam, but he was on the back foot and ready to give it everything. Shot. And suddenly a fine over goes for four, six!
Duminy to Head, 1 run round the wicket, good areas, pushed back to the bowler
Duminy to Warner, no run poked out to point
Duminy to Warner, 1 run on the pads, clipped square, and there is Warner's fifty! Well batted, he is keeping his side afloat ...
Duminy to Head, 1 run crunched through the covers, picks the gap well
Duminy to Wade, no run down on one knee, looking to paddle the ball fine, but can't find the angle
Phehlukwayo to Head, no run full-faced drive but a half-stop in the followthrough
Phehlukwayo to Head, 1 run tapped to the off side for a sharp single
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run solidly onto the front foot, and poked to cover
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run tries a flick to leg, but can't connect
Phehlukwayo to Wade, 2 runs sweetly drilled on the up into the covers. But the outfield is very bumpy as Rababa is nutmegged by a late change of direction, a long chase to save his blushes
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run an offcutter to finish, tidy work
Duminy to Head, 1 run onto the front foot, pushed to the off side
Duminy to Wade, no run forward and defended
Duminy to Wade, 1 run
Duminy to Head, 1 run flicked into the leg side
Duminy to Wade, 1 run chipped out to the deep
Duminy to Head, no run tossed up and driven on the front foot to extra cover
Phehlukwayo to Wade, 1 run Lucky pushes the ball across Wade's bows, he steers to third man
Phehlukwayo to Head, 1 run goes back and opens the face down to third man for one more
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run tighter to the stumps, good-length ball and blocked back to the bowler
Phehlukwayo to Wade, 1 run drilled out to deep cover
Phehlukwayo to Head, no run back of a length, defended to the off side
Phehlukwayo to Head, FOUR runs slashed high and hard through third man. Every little helps!
Duminy to Wade, FOUR runs down on one knee, and slashed fiercely through backward square
Duminy to Wade, no run crunched into the covers
Duminy to Wade, 1 run in the air for a moment or two but no-one on hand in the covers. Another single into the deep
Duminy to Head, 1 run forward and a sharp quick single into the covers
Duminy to Wade, FOUR runs bashed hard into the covers, that's a well placed stroke, and it races past the infield and out of the reach of the sweeper. Shot
Duminy to Wade, no run poked into the off side. Australia keep themselves afloat with another productive over

Phehlukwayo to Head, SIX runs whoosh! Like Sergio at the Ryder Cup, a broad-shouldered bash down the fairway, into the stands at long-off! (And just like Sergio, he's bound now to miss a tiddler for par)
Phehlukwayo to Head, FOUR runs slashed hard behind square, and so nearly a hand to that from Rossouw at backward point!
Phehlukwayo to Head, 1 run another slashing drive, out to the cover boundary
Phehlukwayo to Wade, FOUR runs down on one knee to sweep, and well placed too
Phehlukwayo to Wade, 1 run fenced down to third man
Phehlukwayo to Head, no run rides the bounce outside off
Tahir to Wade, 1 run width and cut hard to deep point
Tahir to Head, FOUR runs crashed out to cover, another well played stroke
Tahir to Head, 1 run low full toss on the toes, clipped hard to the leg side
Tahir to Wade, no run forward, onto the front foot, firmly pushed into the off side
Tahir to Wade, 1 run worked down to long-on
Tahir to Head, 1 run Head keeps the score ticking with another calm push down the ground
Steyn to Head, no run whistling past the edge, that was rapid and in the channel. No contact

Steyn to Head, FOUR runs tight line and cut off a bottom edge, off the top of the stumps and underneath the diving keeper for four. Unlucky for Steyn but he might, at a pinch, accept the moral victory
Steyn to Head, no run full and tight again
Steyn to Head, no run tight line, sharp pace, defended off the back foot
Steyn to Head, no run too good from Steyn, a tight and uncompromising line. Head is looking for the cut, but the ball is through him every time
Steyn to Head, 1 run on the pads, worked into the leg side to keep the strike
Tahir to Head, 1 run thumped down to long-off
Tahir to Wade, FOUR runs well nurdled there from Wade, on the pads, turning down the leg side and just helped round the corner with excellent timing
Tahir to Wade, no run tucked to the leg side again
Tahir to Wade, FOUR runs that's another lovely strike, pumped through backward point as Tahir dropped short with his googly
Tahir to Wade, no run tighter line from Tahir as Wade defends
Tahir to Wade, no run onto the front foot and stoutly blocked
Steyn to Head, 1 run a fraction short and hauled urgently into the leg side
Steyn to Wade, no run back of a length, pushed out to cover
Steyn to Wade, no run ooh, zippy delivery! Wade chased it, it was full and fast, and any bat would surely have flown. But the ball nipped off the deck and eluded everything
Steyn to Wade, no run back and across, defended out to gully
Steyn to Wade, 1 run outside off, dabbed into the covers
Steyn to Head, no run squeezed into the off side from a very full length, looking for the single but there's nothing on offer there. Another tight over
Rabada to Wade, 1 run round the wicket, and Wade works the angle down to third man
Rabada to Head, no run on the back foot, defended to the off side
Rabada to Head, no run round the wicket, very full again, and point is quickly in to keep the batsman hemmed in
Rabada to Head, no run back of a length, nudged out to point once more. Nowhere to go for the moment as Australia sit in for the long haul
Rabada to Head, FOUR runs banged in short, and that's excellent opportunism as Head pulls hard in front of square to bring up his maiden ODI fifty! Well batted
Parnell to Wade, 1 run angled in on the stumps and Wade flicks through midwicket - or to midwicket, rather, as an excellent stop means they have to hurry through
Parnell to Hastings, 1 run round the wicket, slightly short of a length, slashed and slashed hard, thick edge to third man
Parnell to Hastings, no run Hastings on strike as they crossed, he steers one to backward point
Parnell to Hastings, no run pitched up outside off, steps into a ginger prod to cover
Parnell to Hastings, 1 run tip and run into the covers, could be close if du Plessis hits at the striker's end... he doesn't
Rabada to Hastings, no run banged in short, Hastings levers his big frame out of the way
Rabada to Hastings, no run pitched up, comes forward to prod into the covers
Rabada to Hastings, no run angled in on the stumps and pushed back down the track
Rabada to Hastings, 1 run yowzer, that's a spicy meatball, dug in at plus-140kph and Hastings fends it away from in front of his boat race, wide of slip... Think that whacked him on the finger
Rabada to Mennie, 1 wide Mennie shuffles across as Rabada slings one down the leg side
Rabada to Mennie, 1 run touch full on off, 141kph and Mennie shows it a solid straight bat, they pinch one to mid-off, whose throw misses
Rabada to Hastings, 1 leg bye fired in, sliding towards leg, deflects off the pad as Hastings stays back
Parnell to Hastings, no run short outside off, Hastings stabs down into the off side
Parnell to Hastings, SIX runs pitched up and clubbed... waaaaaaaaaayyyyyy into the leg side, in fact it goes all the way, clearing the rope at wide long-on! Some beef in that hit
Parnell to Hastings, SIX runs and again, this time a cross-batted mow down the ground! Not all that short from Parnell but Hastings rocked back and bullocked a swipe over long-on
Parnell to Hastings, 2 runs dug out into the leg side, they come back for two
Parnell to Hastings, no run on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
Parnell to Hastings, no run banged in short to finish, Hastings limbos back and attempts a ramp over the keeper, fails to connect
Tahir to Zampa, 1 run on the stumps, maybe the googly, Zampa blocks into a gap and gets off strike
Tahir to Hastings, 1 run pushed through outside off, goes back and steers a single through point
Tahir to Zampa, no run another rapid legbreak, strikes the pads... but leg side. May have been a slider, actually, out the front of the hand, Zampa was backing away, got an inside edge as well
Tahir to Zampa, no run tossed up and prodded away cautiously
Tahir to Zampa, no run pushed through outside the line of off, steered into the covers
Phehlukwayo to Hastings, 1 run slower ball, nearly does for Hastings, has a hefty thwack at it and gets a top edge that loops wide of the keeper
Phehlukwayo to Zampa, no run length on off, Zampa taps into the covers
Phehlukwayo to Zampa, 1 wide nippy bouncer, flying through above the bat as Zampa throws himself at it - he's only a little guy and that was above head height
Phehlukwayo to Zampa, 1 run
Phehlukwayo to Hastings, FOUR runs full and slogged, Hastings gets a hold of another one and biltongs four out between long-on and deep midwicket

Phehlukwayo to Zampa, no run pitched up and sliced hard towards backward point... who hurls a throw in at the non-striker's end, though Tremain hadn't gone anywhere. Zampa can't be bothered with running on the ricochet
Tahir to Tremain, no run tossed up and bunted into the covers, taken on the bounce
Tahir to Tremain, no run pushed through, comes forward and steers towards point
Tahir to Tremain, no run loopy delivery on off, Tremain punches along the ground to mid-off
Tahir to Tremain, no run goes back and across to a full delivery and squeezes it to backward point
Tahir to Tremain, no run pushed through a bit flatter, defended solidly on off stump
Tahir to Tremain, no run here comes the googly, little bit short and Tremain has time to watch it on to the bat
Phehlukwayo to Zampa, no run shortish outside off, swing and a miss from Zampa
Phehlukwayo to Zampa, no run pitched up and steered to backward point... did it carry? Not sure it did. Either way, he's not out
Phehlukwayo to Zampa, SIX runs in the slot, out the park! Zampa gives Lucky the treatment with a fluid bosh over deep extra cover, that travelled
South Africa won by 142 runs
Player of the match is Faf du Plessis, SA
